model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Well, getting some individual responses to questions and individual attention at times, I think makes a difference. But there is nothing wrong with going to youtube first!  I did!

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker B likes Persian cats and imagines their pets having interesting interactions.
2. Speaker B prefers painting regular people over professionals, discovered love for portraits through a self-portrait with pets.
3. Speaker A reads a novel a week, lives in the city, and goes to pilates class.
4. Both Speaker A and Speaker B enjoy the company of their pets and think they are smart and playful.
5. Speaker A is interested in getting a dog and likes Akitas.
6. Speaker B thinks pit bulls are lovely and has one that is kind and sweet.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: Well, getting some individual responses to questions and individual attention at times, I think makes a difference. But there is nothing wrong with going to youtube first!  I did!
